annotation.TEXT: Another nearly 10-second loading period almost entirely cut out there. And here's the Hard mode's "Run, run, run!" segment!
And yep, those different-looking munchers are collectible during the silver P-switch's effect.
Wow, this is just silly.
I think I'm just about at the end. Here's the feather and flower blocks, and then the ice wall that I have to melt.
The mushroom will give me an extra hit against the ceiling munchers, but if anything knocks me off Yoshi (or I stupidly press A), then I'll die instantly.
And there he is! Boss Bass! Also, since I was told that the bottom of the stream hates me, I'm going to assume there's munchers on the unseeable bottom row here.
Let's do a "science" and find out!
Um... Yeah, I'm not redoing all that, and I was just performing a "science" anyway, so...
Nope. Can't fly over this barrier. Didn't think I'd be able to. Maybe flying under it is possible, but I'm not gonna bother trying.
Well, at least the snowflakes coming out of cannons can't stun-lock me, and only one bullet can reach me during a freeze period, since they fire at the same rate.
Alright, my Yoshi's all grown up now. Okay, so I just have to get to the ON/OFF switch. (Maybe I should've sped this part up until I got there...)
Huh, the floor is slippery, so that's a thing. Also, my power ups were filtered out again, so why did the game give me a flower and feather right in front of the boss door?
Anyway, I hit midpoint and beat up some Chucks, and while I was doing so, the room began auto-scrolling.
Seems like the delay between the two bowling balls, and the delay between the second bowling ball and the Mechakoopas has been reduced.
Uh, oh. Cheepo snowflakes.
There's that volleyball-kicker. (And yes, I remembered to try whacking Asuka with my staff in Tobari, but you should already know that now, if you watch that series.)
So, are we now at the bowling ball phase?
And that's it for the 3-HP system.
Whoops!

From here on out, it's pure heck. 1. The bottom of the stream hates you. 2. Kill the constantly-jumping guys with fire. 3. Well, take it slow, but be quick, too... 4. If someone throws any mushrooms at you, know that the first one is poisoned.
Yeah, I knew that warp was down there. I remembered that that's where the midpoint entrance starts me, and then I get warped to here. (IDK why Yoshi vanished, though.)
Let's do another "science" and find out!
For those that don't know, the double sprite glitch is when you spin jump on two overlapping enemies like this at the same time, but you get hurt.
Now, the message box specifically said that the first mushroom was poisoned. It did not say that all mushrooms were poisoned, so does that mean the next one is safe?
But, obviously, WMM barfed again. Man, I really should've double-checked for this before uploading.
Oh, when there's too many sprites, donut blocks don't even shake/drop, because the shaking donut blocks are actually sprites.
Cirno and Dai's Castle (Hard)
...Wait, I'm okay. Wow, I thought I was gonna die to invisible troll blocks again.
Alright, is the audio all better now? Good. Now WMM, you better not hiccup again during the next sped-up part.
Now, that message box said that if someone throws mushrooms at me, the first one will be poisoned. Does that mean... Peach is gonna try to poison me right here?
Oh, and there was no additional "midpoint" just before the boss room, so restarting from here would require redoing the Boss Bass and the "Run, run, run!" rooms.
So, how many hits will it take to end this phase? Will it be 4 again?
Push!
Well, 4 hits have been landed, but this phase is still going.
Don't care about the clock, or the flames, just go! (Good thing I was able to spare a hit there!)
Okay, I'm good. Now for layer 2 munchers.
Yeah, no OW music again. So next time, I'll likely be finishing up Hard mode!
This looks like a tight fit, but I can certainly make it.
Oh, geez... Okay, here's the silver P-switch that'll put an end to Boss Bass.
Uh, oh. This could be a thing. I hope that Urchin gets out of my way in time...
Wow, so the bottom row is actually safe to stand on, and I'm surprised I didn't get hit or eaten there!
Anyway, this scene is exactly the same as in the original SMW, so I've sped it up here. (I hope WMM doesn't hiccup again!)
Of course, all these sprites are making the game lag again, so I'm going to speed up part of this room too, but I'm beginning to dread that now, with WMM acting up lately...
It's vanilla Bowser. Well, obviously, I disabled the sound channels for this one, but there's still a channel playing music. Also, the eyes of Bowser's clown car look weird.
Anyway, I expect you-know-who to show up...
Next, Lava Lotuses. Fortunately, I can eat the top one to make things a little easier.
Hello, and welcome back to Scarlet Devil Mario! Okay, before I proceed to the next level, someone gave me a request regarding this level, Icicle Fall (Hard).
Well, the autoscroll is no longer in effect, and this area's gimmick seems to be disabled now as well.
Oh, good! WMM worked correctly this time! Anyway, the coins are gonna fall into this pool of water, so I guess I'll try to collect a few of them.
And, layer 2 Jelectros.
I see that layer 2 block there. And, as expected, we have the temperature gauge here. Can't let that empty.
That's a big fat lie. Mario's adventure is not over yet. There's still at least one Hard level left, and then the entire Lunatic difficulty.
Sounds like the audio's got the hiccups. It should maybe have a glass of water, or maybe have someone suddenly scare it.
Maybe have them bounce around off of the edges of the screen like a game of Pong, or something like that...
1 hit.
Awesome, that's all the Yoshi coins.
Yep. Of course, the bowling balls are as easy to dodge as ever. There needs to be a hack that puts an interesting twist on Bowser's bowling ball phase somehow...
Well, that's 2 right there.
Ah, 6 hits did it! Okay, so Bowser took 4+6+6=16 hits total to defeat. Not really hard, even with the slippery floor. It just took longer than usual, that's all.
Brutal combo! (6 hits, 2400 points)
Demo count: April fools!
But, I broke the gimmick here with the avoid death glitch before, so I'm going to redo this area legit.
Not much of a threat anymore.
Umm... what? Okay, what am I looking at here?
Hopefully, this black screen will go away soon...
WMM, what did I just say? ...Uggghhh...
I would've just replaced the music entirely, but I decided to leave this "music" playing like this instead.
Okay, 4 hits is what it took to end the first phase.
Can I hit Boss Bass with a Goomba? Of course not, but I'll try in vain anyway.
Strangely, my fireballs can go through this barrier, but that doesn't exactly help me. Well, that house will filter out my power ups, so I think I'm done trying stuff here.
I guess I gotta wait for the Urchins to come over, and then spin jump on them to get through. I'd better watch out for the double sprite glitch as I do this.
Okay, here we go. The audio should come back and gradually sync back up with the video.
5 hits.
Yep, that's a great start alright.
LOL, that just happened. Fortunately, there's another flower right here.
LOL, eyes.
Whoa, a surprise torpedo launcher as well? I'm lucky that didn't hit me.
3 hits for real here.
Ack! This is a bad time to get frozen!
Well, being about halfway done with the annotating now, I'm not reuploading at this point. Anyway, the audio should be back again soon.
I guess you're forced to get frozen there.
Anyway, the double sprite glitch was easily avoidable here, and the slowdown made this easier than it would normally be.
WMM hiccups: 3
Ha! Yeah, I saw that volleyball up there!
Close call there.
BGM: Bomberman 64 - White Ice
3 hits... or not. What the heck? Okay, apparently, Mechakoopas on the very left edge of the screen cannot hit Bowser.
No Yoshis because they're still suffering from April Fools Day pranks that were played on them.
Whoa, I'd better not screw up again while trying to get into that pipe...
Alright, let's resume our quest with Perfect Freeze (Hard)!
Again, be careful of the wooden blocks, since their sides are bouncy.
Yep, I've gone back to the flame-dodging part just after beating Bowser's first phase, and this time, I won't be touching that poison mushroom.
And apparently, this includes the effect of the feather making me fiery, so now I can actually be caped here! Hmm... Can I break anything in the next area with the cape?
Oh, no you don't. I forget whether this guy was a bouncer or a splitter, but either way, I stopped his special action from occurring.
Umm... I think it would be best if I wasn't holding the shell while trying to swim through this Jelectro-lined passage.
Alright, let's toggle this thing OFF, and then, when I get to the mushroom, I won't execute the avoid death glitch this time. I'll just collect it normally.
Uh, oh. A Snowball-Pitchin' Chuck. Very high threat.
Same ol', same ol'... Oh, hold on. I gotta pause to show this.
I'm surprised I didn't get my butt cut up there.
Yeah, the coins from fried enemies move at the same speed as this auto-scroll, and if there are enough of them, the sprite limit will prevent more enemies from spawning.
Okay, I'm going to speed up the footage again here. WMM, please behave this time, and properly return to normal speed near the end of this room!
Alright, this one's good! Okay, time for the final phase! I bet it'll take a lot of hits to beat, so I'll be counting them as I go.
Ah, and at last, I have rescued Patchouli... Wait, that's a different game. I rescued Peach here!
And you know what, with this room being as laggy and boring as it is, I'm going to speed up some of it here. Now, don't hiccup again, WMM...
Oh, I should try to fry as many as I can, but leave their coins alone.
Oh, and the 3-HP system came back again.
Okay, let's resume, and... no surprise here-- Bowser's HP is higher than usual.
So, actually, I meant to have the speed up effect end just before that tight Torpedo Ted escape back there, where I discovered the bottom row was safe.
And, my power ups got filtered out again. Just great. Also, this room took nearly 10 seconds to load for whatever reason, so I cut nearly all of that out.
...You're kidding.
Pfft... Great start there.
Alright, 6 hits ended this phase. So, was the increased HP even necessary? It didn't really up the challenge level at all. It just made this take longer and that's it.
I intentionally let myself get frozen there, just so those snowflakes couldn't freeze me at a bad time elsewhere.
Whoa.
Science count: 4
Oh, no... NOOOOO!!!
That's weird how that sound effect repeats rapidly like that when you swim downward while holding something during slowdown.
...Yep. Bowser must've spiked that mushroom or something, knowing Peach was gonna toss it at me.
Okay, this section makes me fiery and uses the 3-HP system.
4 hits.
It's because you bounce off of one of them, but then the game sees that you're now ascending when it checks for your collision with the second one, and that hurts you.
Alright, from this point forward, things'll be different from when I previously played this level.
Ooh, power ups, and a boss door. Alright, who's it gonna be this time?
Space-time rewind count: 12
I assume I'll need this shell to swim faster here.
2 hits.
This is the level where you have to stay on Yoshi while the switch is OFF, or you die.
To be continued... Ze!
WMM hiccups: 2
Oh, no... Really, WMM? I only meant to speed up another 10-second loading screen there, and not the message box... Well, I'll still show the translation for 10 seconds.
